textBeforeTable: The collection names contained in the following table define the SMIL 2.0 Profile vocabulary. MediaAccessibility Module BrushMedia Module MediaParam Module MediaClipMarkers Module MediaClipping Module BasicMedia Module Media functionality TransitionModifiers Module CoordinatedTransitions Module BasicTransitions Module Transition Effects functionality ObjectLinking Module LinkingAttributes Module BasicLinking Module Linking functionality HierarchicalLayout Module MultiWindowLayout Module AudioLayout Module BasicLayout Module Layout functionality SkipContentControl Module PrefetchControl Module CustomTestAttributes Module BasicContentControl Module Content Control functionality BasicAnimation Module Animation functionality FillDefault Module RestartDefault Module SyncBehaviorDefault Module SyncBehavior Module RestartTiming Module PrevTiming Module ExclTimeContainers Module BasicTimeContainers Module AccessKeyTiming Module MultiArcTiming Module WallclockTiming Module RepeatValueTiming Module RepeatTiming Module MinMaxTiming Module EventTiming Module SyncbaseTiming Module BasicInlineTiming Module Timing functionality Metainformation Module Metainformation functionality Structure Module Structure functionality The SMIL 2.0 Language Profile supports the timeline-centric multimedia features found in the SMIL 2.0 modules. It uses only modules from the SMIL 2.0 recommendation. As the language profile includes the mandatory modules, it is a SMIL Host Language conforming language profile. This language profile includes the following SMIL 2.0 modules: 13.3.3 The SMIL 2.0
textAfterTable: In the following sections, we define the set of elements and attributes used in each of the modules included in the SMIL 2.0 Profile. The content model for each element is described. The Content Model of an element is a description of elements which can appear as its direct children. The special Content Model "EMPTY" means that a given element may not have children. Collection Name Attributes in Collection Core id (ID), class(NMTOKEN), title (CDATA), alt (CDATA), longdesc (CDATA), xml:base (CDATA) I18n xml:lang (NMTOKEN) The id, class and title attributes in the collection Core are defined for all the elements of the SMIL 2.0 Profile. The id attribute is used in the SMIL 2.0 Language Profile to assign a unique XML identifier to every element in a SMIL document. In this document, equivalent but deprecated attributes and elements are in parenthesis. 13.3.4 Animation Module The Animation Module provides a framework for incorporating animation into a timing framework, and a mechanism for composing the effects of multiple animations.
